body: @sxjscience you can use [train_mnist.py](https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/example/image-classification/train_mnist.py) with option `--gpus 0,1`, the program will be stuck at [this line](https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/python/mxnet/metric.py#L137) the third time get here.

>>> a[0:0]
array([], dtype=float64)
>>> b=mx.nd.array(a)
>>> b[0:0].asnumpy()
array([ 0.,  0.,  0.,  0.,  0.], dtype=float32)

There is no rule on what you cannot do inside an operator, as long as the function finishes means the operator completes
@ziyeqinghan Thanks!

> 非常感谢. 
> 总结下, 有两种解决办法. 
> 
> ```
> for i in range(len(data)):
>     X = data[i].transpose((1, 2, 0))
>     plt.figure()
>     plt.axis('off')
>     plt.imshow(X.astype(np.uint8))
> ```
> 
> 或
> 
> ```
> for i in range(len(data)):
>     X = data[i].transpose((1, 2, 0))
>     X = cv2.cvtColor(X, cv2.COLOR_RGB2BGR)
>     cv2.imwrite("result%d.png"%(i), X)
> ```

We tested on local machine by using two workers:

```
../../tools/launch.py -n 2 python train_mnist.py --kv-store dist_sync
```
Your layers are too small (hidden=2) and there are too many of them. Kernel launch overhead is dominating.

我将/mxnet/tools/im2rec.py文件copy到d:/test文件夹下。同时，将2类图片文件（各10张，各10个JPEG文件）分别放到d:/test/train/folder1和d:/test/train/folder2下。我用原来老版的make_list.py文件运行生成了lst文件，路径是d:/test/train1.lst，但现在我用im2rec.py来生成rec文件总是报错，请教，是什么问题呢？
具体语句及错误提示如下:
 D:\test>python im2rec.py d:/test/train1.lst d:/test/train/ d:/test/train1.rec
  File "im2rec.py", line 36
    def make_list(prefix_out, root, recursive, exts, num_=s, train_ratio):
SyntaxError: non-default argument follows default argument

补充说明，我用make_list.py文件运行生成了lst文件的语句如下：
D:\test>python make_list.py d:/test/train d:/test/train1 --recursive=True
d:/test/train
d:/test/train\model1
d:/test/train\model2

然后可以在d:/test目录下可以看到文件d:/test/train1.lst
@albertyou2 ，请教这个错误提示是什么原因呢？
Ok, then current pr should be good to handle type issue.

@luoruisichuan 你用的是系统系统？我看你的符号有问题 windows系统 路径是 \不是/

另外他这个im2rec有点问题，或者我用法有问题。我把windows下的用法发给你看看哈：

0）注意：windows下 multproccess有问题，我退回到这个版本 《mxnet-20160202》下的tools的 im2rec.py

注意，我没有用他的自动吧train分开的功能，我觉得这个功能有问题。我手动的吧数据分为 train,val,pred三个文件夹然后分别产生list和rec文件

1）.制作 LIST（以生成pred数据为例子）
我把im2rec.py这个文件拷贝到数据存在文件夹，比如叫data,然后data里有train,val,pred三个文件夹，分别存放训练，验证，预测数据，然后运行

python im2rec.py .\pred\ .\pred\ --list=1 --recursive=1

然后会在pred里面生成三个文件，其中只有_train.lst有数据，把它改名为pred.lst，然后拷贝到data文件夹

同样方法处理 train,red,val

2)制作REC
python im2rec.py .\pred .\pred\ --resize=50 --quality 100

就会生成pred.rec文件
然后同样处理train,val
但我用make_list.py文件运行生成了lst文件没有问题呢。我刚才把/都改为\试了下，还是不行，估计不是这个问题。
我用的im2rec是最新版的，是把make_list和im2rec合并到im2rec.py中一起了的，不知道是什么问题。

你有没有老版的将make_list和im2rec分开的im2rec.py文件？我想比较下是否新版本im2rec.py（github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/tools/im2rec.py）的问题.
谢谢
@luoruisichuan 看下我最新的回复，我没找到他最新的版本的用法
方便QQ号码请教下么
@luoruisichuan 13800497

@hjk41 so MxNet is still slower than caffe on CPU for now? 
i'm going to trying MxNet.
机器要么是ＣＰＵ被占满，要么是内存被占满，你是哪种情况？
都没有占满，CPU有一个核满了，但是其他的都空闲，内存还有很多，一旦我设置batch_size为100，机器就特别卡，移动鼠标都不流畅
mxnet could install through  binary package like tensorflow: pip install --upgrade $TF_BINARY_URL or pip install mxnet.whl.  Install will be much more easy.
@anxingle The make should be fine. Maybe you are not running make under the MXNet directory?
@MrPig Which CuDNN version are you using?

@sxjscience 
libcudnn.so
libcudnn.so.7.0
libcudnn.so.7.0.58
libcudnn_static.a
最新的MXNET不支持CUDNNV3.你可以用老的v0.7.0
CPU和内存都没占满的情况下还能造成卡死，这个比较奇怪。
@sxjscience    Thank you. I run make in mxnet.  and I can run (compile ) mxnet in cpu model.
@starimpact 最新的mxnet只支持cudnn v2么？ 我也很奇怪啊，卡的鼠标移动不流畅，说明是显存上的问题，所以我怀疑是不是mxnet里面的卷积操作有问题。符号建立的代码和tensorflow的基本差不多，可是tensorflow的可以轻松跑100 的batch_size，卷积核的数量可以到500，而我的卷积核的数量才100，。
mxnet也不支持V2， libcudnn.7.0实际上是v3, 最新的MXNET只支持V4以上的CUDNN。
@starimpact 刚才重新换了cudnn v4， 发现编译通过了，并且我上面的问题也解决了，现在可以运行了，不会卡了，看来是cudnn的问题，非常感谢回答

I have the same problem,waiting for solution.

@vchuravy I have a updated Dtype pooling [branch](https://github.com/Godricly/mxnet/tree/DTypePooling) based on your work. Can you double check this one and submit a pr? My fork of MxNet is kind of messy now.

It's due to auto tune being run for each bucket. For the moment you can turn it off with cudnn_tune=False.

@tqchen What would be a better solution?

If you create your own threads you have to handle cuda context yourself. Otherwise cuda will use the default context. The engine usually handles all threading. Instead of creating threads try pushing op to the engine

Running two GPU program on the same GPU is usually a bad idea.
TF explicitly bans. MXNet allows it so that it doesn't crash other program but you shouldn't run two mxnet on the same GPU nontheless
Dropout is turned off for prediction. The layer is there but it doesn't function
You mean convolution without weight sharing? No

@HrWangChengdu Is this currently functional?

Could you give a list of things needed before we can merge in a functional initial version?

Thank you @sbodenstein !
Let's discuss after you create PR.

@antinucleon: the forward pass in inference mode is now consistent with Torch. But I'm having problems with the backward pass. Particularly, problems are caused by the dropout descriptor, which requires a permanent state attached at initialization (see cudnnSetDropoutDescriptor), and according to the docs, "No other function should be writing to the memory pointed at by states argument while this function is running. The user is expected not to change memory pointed at by states for the duration of the computation." If you use NULL for the states (and remove dropout rate as an optional parameters), it causes failures in cudnnRNNForwardTraining. 

Its not simply a piece of workspace memory like the other examples, which get generic chunks of memory doing a forward or a backward pass. There is also no cuDNN dropout layer, so don't know how best to solve this from the other examples. cudaMalloc some memory? I would really appreciate your opinion on dealing with this issue.
I guess is I figure out the problem: the network itself is not capable of predict so much output at a time.
@sbodenstein Put it in an additional invisible output. See batchnorm for example. Could you open a PR first to make discussion easier?

Sorry, I'm in the course due of my graduate school, would be available in 1 or 2 days. Thanks for understanding.
Yes. But only forked dmlc/caffe would work, which add several extra interfaces. In the release version, we could provide a patch for those extra codes.
List of things before we can merge:
- replace by caffe registry
- refine caffe-plugin docs (also interface discussion)
- pull request dmlc/caffe to get patch number
- python metric modification
What did you add? Is it possible to do it without adding anything to caffe?

Ok I see. You had to access the private blobs. Looks like simple addition of 3 functions.
In that case let's try PR this back to caffe & generate a patch for users. Should be an easy patch.
but why cpu mode is way faster? @piiswrong
Yes! that's what i mean :-)
Because cpu doesn't need to launch gpu kernels

@sbodenstein @piiswrong @antinucleon I suggest wrapping RNN in the script language. We can write a stand-alone CuDNNRNN operator (only calls the rnn API in cuDNN) and build another python class to call this operator together with other operators like dropout. To decide whether to use CuDNNRNN, we can call an API function that determines the compiled cudnn version.
@George19890617 Use `shape` instead of `target_shape`
@piiswrong Would it be better to turn off the auto-tuning by default?
I'm thinking about it. The thing is in most cases (without bucketing) it improves performance by 20%
@horserma Have you solve your problem with SliceChannel? I also meet the same problem just like you.

@xlvector I have installed baidu warp-ctc and do as your readme introduction to rebuild mxnet but when I run lstm_ocr.py it occurs an error, module object has no attribute 'WarpCTC' how can I solve this problem, I run on Mac OS X
@liuzhi136 which one do you mean, to be more precise?

@liuzhi136 You need to set the `axis`, which is 1 by default. Change the line to

```
data3_slice = mx.symbol.SliceChannel(data = data_sym3, num_outputs=5, axis=0)
```

@sxjscience Thanks for your reply. I just try it. It does make sense. When I print the result, I always get only one output. Now I realize there are five outputs in the exe.outputs. So exe.outputs[0] is one result. Thanks a lot!
@sxjscience Do you know the meaning about squeeze_axis parameter? I realy do not understand the explaination of it  in the doc page.

@liuzhi136 Suppose you have a tensor with shape (3, 10, 5). If you slice it using `SliceChannel(data, num_outputs=10, squeeze_axis=True)`, you can get ten (3, 5) tensors. If `squeeze_axis=False`, you will get ten (3, 1, 5) tensors.
@sxjscience  I get it. Thank you so much! This parameter just form data into concise way, right?
@liuzhi136 Yes. It can be useful in slicing the time-series data used in RNN.
@precedenceguo @winstywang Turned off auto tune by default. Can be turned on with env var.
